channel.description: Trendland Loves Fashion, we review everything related to Fashion, Trends, Design, Illustrators, Art, Music, Celebrities and More...

channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: Welcome To Cyana Trendland Feed ! Hope you like our information and don't forget to share it :) Enjoy...

item.title: Spot — Studio™ a New Barcelona based Artistic Creative Studio
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
The young Barcelona-based creative studio Spot — Studio™ offer a unique design process where the dialogue between CGI and photography results on a poetic way to communicate ideas. Focused on the basis of graphic design and best of trends in 3D / CGI , the studio, directed by Nicolás Cañellas,

The post Spot — Studio™ a New Barcelona based Artistic Creative Studio appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: The New and Trendy White’s Dry Cleaners [Montreal]
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
A modern day dry cleaner treating garments to eco products only. That was the concept for the Montreal-based White‘s that aims to bring greater transparency to the dry cleaner’s craft. Inspired by the aesthetics of Parisian apartments, the interior beams with pristine white and occasional insets of gold, marble and chevron floors. It was designed by a local practice Ivy Studio. Noble materials were highlighted via the abundant natural light while tall, industrial ceilings got cosier thanks to hanging lamps […]

The post The New and Trendy White’s Dry Cleaners [Montreal] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Sharing Worlds by Zim & Zou
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
“Sharing Worlds” by a French duet Zim & Zou is an art project for the Noble Prize Museum in Sweden. Inspired by two novels – ‘Kristin Lavransdatter’ written by Sigrid Undset and ‘One Hundred Years of Solitude’ by Gabriel Garcia Marquez – the cut-out worlds aim to reflect the settings of these literary piece. The first is located in 14th century Trondheim while the second installation resembles the house inside which Marquez’s story takes place. With strong attention to details […]

The post Sharing Worlds by Zim & Zou appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: ‘Eat Darling Eat’ is a Postmodernist Dessert Laboratory [Hong Kong ]
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
‘Eat Darling Eat’ is a dessert laboratory in Hong Kong, offering customers a visual respite from bustling Causeway Bay neighborhood with their whimsical interiors that mirror the imaginative, eclectic menu of delicious bites and the brand’s innovative philosophy of rediscovering classic childhood desserts, with a very contemporary twist. The interior designed by NC Design and Architecture, stimulates visual senses with provocative tones and textures that celebrate the art of dessert making. The design aesthetic is fully immersive, creating an illusory […]

The post ‘Eat Darling Eat’ is a Postmodernist Dessert Laboratory [Hong Kong ] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: NOT A STILL LIFE by Studio Kleiner
item.dc:creator: Cyril Foiret
item.description:
NOT A STILL LIFE is the new exhibition project born during the residence in Versilia of Swedish photographers Studio Kleiner, invited by LABottega to immerse themselves in an experience that develops and is completed within the place itself. Elements and materials encountered in the area contribute to building the balances and impossible situations of their photographic imagery. Studio Kleiner addresses the multiple themes of the contradiction between reality and fiction, gravity and weightlessness, movement and balance. The result is an […]

The post NOT A STILL LIFE by Studio Kleiner appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Paul Wackers’ Plant World in Painting
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
Paul Wackers is a Connecticut-raised, Brooklyn-based painter whose works are still lifes occupying deserted, cluttered spaces. Inspired by figurative painting and baroque artists such as Dutch Willem van Aelst, Wackers’ landscapes are filled with obsolete objects, plants and windows “offering an insight in a parallel reality”. His art combines the variety of old and modern influences that result in complex landscapes referencing to the masters of the Golden Age yet set in contemporary contexts. www.paulwackers.com

The post Paul Wackers’ Plant World in Painting appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Rubinacci Napoli Lookbook by Terzo Piano
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
The furniture look book for Rubinacci Napoli art directed by Terzo Piano and captured by Thomas Pagani makes the most of clean, open spaces and the modern character of Rubinacci’s designs. Set against the arch vaults of a minimalist palazzo, the images present a few objects each. The natural light exposes the craft and quality details of the furniture carved from wood, leather and glass. Soft color palette gives a serene feel to the catalogue that appears more like a […]

The post Rubinacci Napoli Lookbook by Terzo Piano appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: The Trendy Creative Direction of Leslie David Studio
item.dc:creator: Cyril Foiret
item.description:
Leslie David is a French designer, illustrator and art director. She opened her creative studio opened in 2010 and focuses on visual thinking and design in the fields of fashion, beauty, art, music and culture. The spectrum of their work is broad and very on trend! Leslie directs and designs projects ranging from branding, print, digital, patterns, products, films and animations for brands including Chanel Beauty, Nike, Adidas, Ed Banger, Diptyque and Glossier amongst others. Represented by Hugo & Marie […]

The post The Trendy Creative Direction of Leslie David Studio appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Mass Production of Happiness by Yingxuan Teo
item.dc:creator: Cyril Foiret
item.description:
Singapore based visual artist Yingxuan Teo recently release her ‘Mass Production of Happiness’ series. To fight against all the chemicals and unknown ingredients found in soaps and shampoos, the artist envisioned a future with no more plastic soap bottles and homemade soap, but only with little machines which add a new ritual in our everyday lives. Does this make our Earth happier? (be sure to watch short video below) There are tonnes of chemicals ingredients in the soap and shampoo […]

The post Mass Production of Happiness by Yingxuan Teo appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Confronting With Disturbing Beauty with ‘Fresh Meat’ Editorial
item.dc:creator: Claire Granlund
item.description:
The photography duo Julia SH and Nic Sadler, known as SHSadler talks strategy on the battle against standards. Julia and Nic show their concern about the challenge of the world’s social pressure and the wasted hours sifting through filters. As we seem to raise more awareness about beauty standards and focus on diversity, there is not enough change happening. We do see more diversity but equally people that go to extremes to get those Instagram approved faces or bodies. The […]

The post Confronting With Disturbing Beauty with ‘Fresh Meat’ Editorial appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Merijn Hos Gradient Illustrations
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
Merijn Hos is an artist and illustrator from Utrecht, the Netherlands. He divides his time between working as a commercial illustrator and working on his own personal projects, exhibitions, and independent publishing. Merijn is also renowned for his beautiful wooden sculptures. His curious, optimistic characters and passion for mixed-media are testament to Merijn’s ability to make every brief as important as the last, and treat every commission with the same respect and attention as his personal work. Merijn’s clients include […]

The post Merijn Hos Gradient Illustrations appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Serene House in the Park [Zurich]
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
The minimalist house in Zurich by Think Architecture is an example of a building harmoniously blending in the surrounding space. In fact, it appears an an intrinsic part of the landscape comprising of the nearby forest and lake Zurich. The monumental concrete facade gives a sense of entering a temple. Still, it is elegant and unassuming, connecting the interiors with the exterior. With every single room offering an access to the park, nature complements sleek surfaces sculpted in marble, terrazzo, […]

The post Serene House in the Park [Zurich] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: The Lovely Illustrations for Danish Council on Climate
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
Danish creative agency Hvass & Hannibal commissioned Norwegian graphic designer Trine Natskår to illustrate the latest campaign of the Danish Council on Climate (KLIMARÅDET). These illustrations were made for the Council’s report on transitioning towards lower emissions in 2030. Date: 2017 Client: The Danish Council on Climate Change / Klimarådet www.klimarådet.dk Commissioned by: Trine Natskår www.trinetrine.no www.hvasshannibal.dk

The post The Lovely Illustrations for Danish Council on Climate appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Looking For Your Next Burning Man Mask ?
item.dc:creator: Cyril Foiret
item.description:
Look no further! Artist Magnhild Kennedy, best known as Damselfrau work with masks as autonomous works of art as well as ‘action-objects’ (wearable accessories). For her, the mask is a place where different elements come together as a composition. Damselfau creations are made from materials found on the street or previously owned by other persons. She has used fine lace, worn by Nineteenth Century Norwegian author Camilla Collett, some hair from 200 years old Japanese Geisha as well as everyday […]

The post Looking For Your Next Burning Man Mask ? appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Stunning Boutique Hotel in Sorrento: Maison La Minervetta [Italy]
item.dc:creator: Cyril Foiret
item.description:
Perched precariously on the cliffs of Sorrento along the Amalfi Coast, Maison La Minervetta hotel showcases spectacular sea views. Built in the 50s, the luxurious boutique hotel was returned to the original family owners, restored and rebranded in 2006. Each of the 12 nautical inspired rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with view on the sea and Marina Grande and is only a 15-minute walk from the historic center. Today the Minervetta has become the owners home and their ‘guests’ house, beautifully […]

The post Stunning Boutique Hotel in Sorrento: Maison La Minervetta [Italy] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Humble Pizza Swamped in Pink [London]
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
Humble Pizza is a new culinary spot on the food map of London. Located in beautiful suburb of Chelsea, the interior was designed by a local Child Studio. “The inspiration for the design came from the staple of British vernacular postwar architecture – the ‘Formica caffs’, which first appeared in London’s West End in the 1950s, several of them have survived intact to this day,” claim the architects who wanted to capture the spirit of city’s coffee culture at its […]

The post Humble Pizza Swamped in Pink [London] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Levitating Neon Installation
item.dc:creator: Guest Writer
item.description:
Street artist Spidertag works since 2008 with different medium than spray paint to construct murals. The result in clean geometrical grey lines during the day lights up at twilight for the pleasure of the eyes. Taking inspiration from modern architecture, current murals and other form of arts like music, literature, cinema, he reinterprets the meaning of minimalism and geometry. The flexible wires create murals that invites us into a levitating world. Look up! Written for Trendland by guest writer Marie-Michèle […]

The post Levitating Neon Installation appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: The Art of the Click at Beyond the Streets [Brooklyn]
item.dc:creator: Nicole Ianniello
item.description:
Beyond the Streets is an exhibition currently in Williamsburg, NY curated by Roger Gastman which features over a hundred artists whose work displays different mediums that showcase street art, graffiti, and more. Since graffiti is temporary, the documentation is essential. Now we’re in an era of continuous swiping, Instagramming, and snapping. That second, or “The Art of the Click” is the exact moment and memory that we will have into the future. A few of the photographers featured in Beyond […]

The post The Art of the Click at Beyond the Streets [Brooklyn] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: The Future of Print Envisioned by Rubio [Valencia]
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
Creative studio Masquespacio designed the first flagship store of Cuadernos Rubio, a Spanish publisher of educational books in Valencia. Founded by a schoolteacher in 1956, the company specializes in calligraphy and math-friendly notebooks for children, but later expanded to add lifestyle notebooks for adults. For this trendy store interior the agency’s founders Ana and Chris chose small white tiles for floors and walls as a backdrop for the stations divided by transparent acrylic panels in vivid colors. At these stations, […]

The post The Future of Print Envisioned by Rubio [Valencia] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: THYANE Skincare Retro Brand Identity
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
THYANE is a Korean skincare brand inspired by the concept of shopping in a mysterious forest. Designed by Content Form Context, the visual identity and packaging resembles the vintage aesthetic of old beauty products. Balanced with modern typography and a minimalist color palette, the products are presented against whimsical backgrounds made of moist forest flora and tree bark. They serve as a visual representation of the natural ingredients of THAYNE’s cosmetics. www.contentformcontext.com

The post THYANE Skincare Retro Brand Identity appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: Sad Colors of the Ocean by Julia Potato
item.dc:creator: Marta Knas
item.description:
Julia Potato is a Moscow-based artist and photographer, inspired by surrealism and abstraction but her latest project titled “Sad Colors of the Ocean” is down-to-earth.The images show plastic picked from the Tenerife’s beaches, arranged into color-synced compositions set against solid backgrounds. Potato tries to aestheticize the damages inflicted to the planet and captures pieces of plastic in a form of a still life. Impeccable photographs appear unsettling as soon as we realize their context. www.behance.net/juliapotato

The post Sad Colors of the Ocean by Julia Potato appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: The Digital Art of Dorian Legret
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
French digital artist Dorian Legret has done some incredible and colorful artworks. Based in Orléans, France, his creations have strong personality and stand out immediately for the bright colors mixed with psychedelic feels. Dorian’s style is influenced by the famous Vaporwave, from which he takes inspiration for standard elements such as the statues with their hidden faces by colors and lines, for an incredibly aesthetic result and immediate visual impact, in fact, the gradient effect stands out. Perspectives, point of […]

The post The Digital Art of Dorian Legret appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: A New ‘Dandy’ Restaurant in Montreal
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
Enjoy this chic new breakfast, lunch, brunch spot Dandy located in the Old Montreal. Chef Michael Tozzi has hired local interior design firm Blazys Gérard, to conceive this elegant, warm and timeless new restaurant. The building, complete with historic windows, is juxtaposed with smooth, curving arches, and architectural light fixtures, «For us, light is a material, we play with it and sculpt it as we do with any other material», says the firm. The team wanted to enhance the building’s […]

The post A New ‘Dandy’ Restaurant in Montreal appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: ‘Do No Harm’ Miss Bugs New Installation at Jealous Gallery
item.dc:creator: Trendland Team
item.description:
Mixed media artist Miss Bugs is set to unveil her new installation, entitled “Do No Harm” at jealous gallery in London. The installation consists of 900 vibrant colored resin ‘popsicles’, that is containing a range of pharmaceuticals, critique contemporary society’s obsession and consumption of social media. Miss Bugs continues to draw on the theme of addiction to digital technology, and how over exposure to news reels and digital feeds can act as an anesthetic and numb the sense of reality. […]

The post ‘Do No Harm’ Miss Bugs New Installation at Jealous Gallery appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.

item.title: American Design Takes Center Stage @ Witness Apartment [New York]
item.dc:creator: Ani Tzenkova
item.description:
This month we unveil Open Studio at Witness Apartment featuring objects from Studio Junto, a new designer I discovered at one of Wallplay‘s spaces on Canal, fresh out of design school, as well as New York based Jack Rabbit Studio, Pat Kim Design and Richard Clarkson Studio showcasing some of their latest designs.  This is the first edition of Open Studios at Witness Apartment established to collaborate with emerging talent and showcase new designs in the context of the Apartment. Studio […]

The post American Design Takes Center Stage @ Witness Apartment [New York] appeared first on Trendland Online Magazine Curating the Web since 2006.
